New Records: Ryan Helsley notched his 42nd save in 45 tries, setting a new career-high record.
The Cardinals secured their first win at Yankee Stadium since 2009 and their first over the Yankees in the Bronx since 1964.
The victory marked the first time since 1964 that a Gibson (Bob in 1964 and Kyle in 2024) pitched the winning game for the Cardinals.
Key Match Events: Ryan Helsley used a slider to outwit Austin Wells and end the game, showcasing his pitching maturity.
Brendan Donovan hit a three-run homer to key a four-run third inning.
Giancarlo Stanton came within inches of tying the score with a drive off the center-field wall.
Post-Match Reflections: Cardinals manager Oliver Marmol marveled at Helsley's ability to lock in during high-pressure moments.
Helsley admitted that the club record for saves is a goal this season.
Ryan Helsley was compared to Hall of Famers Bruce Sutter and Lee Smith for his pitching prowess.
